round_1: ^Heya! How are you? My name's Otis! It's great to meet you!
^I like your profile pic, you look super nice.
^It's a real shame these phones don't have smell too. You can learn a lot about someone that way y'know?

g-1: ^Hey, so would you like to chat for a bit?
^It's so good to get to speak to someone new, I get a little stir crazy sometimes!
^There's only so many times you can read White Fang before you start looking for someone to talk to... or a Yukon forest to run in.

c-1: ^I'm more of a Lassie: Come home fan
^Oh, uh... yeah. I-I like that one too...
c-2: ^I've been meaning to read that one!
^You really should! It's so good it makes me want to bark!
c-3: ^I love that story, but Beauty Smith is a monster.
^But Scott is such a good person, you need a terrible villian to show him against.

part_1: ^As you enter the Holbrook Shelter you see a little black and brown Dachshund playing with another dog.
^When you approach he notices you and gives an
^Oh hey! It's so good to see you! I
^ enjoyed our chat together. I was hoping I'd get to meet you in person.

g-1: ^, she and I started a book club together... Only, we're the only ones to join.
^Oh, but it's still great to talk about new books!
^Say, do you have any other dogs at home?

s: ^Yes! A house isn't a home without a dog.
^No, one doggo is enough of a handful for me!

c-1: ^Oh how wonderful! I should have known. I can even smell them on you. I'd love to meet them sometime.
c-2: ^That's a bit sad, but perhaps we could find another forever friend together?

part_2: ^The two of you fall into an easy stroll around the exercise yard as you chat. As you walk and talk you notice Otis is struggling to keep up.

c-0: ^Well... I'm never going to say no to a little walk... you've just got long legs.
c-1: ^It's nice to sit and chat. I've only got these little legs, sometimes I get a little worn out.

g-1: ^So, do you go for lots of longer walks?

c-3: ^Oh, yeah. I guess so, I hadn't really thought about it.
c-4: ^... Yeah. All that... nature... and ticks.
c-5: ^ I don't mind them, it's nice to get out sometimes.
^Yeah, I like a good walk. Just not all the time.
c-6: ^An armchair? By a fire? With a book?

part_1: ^You see the black and brown coat of little Otis as you approach the little restaurant in the park.
^Otis is looking uneasy amongst the bustle of park. Kids run around the little fellow making him twitch and flinch.
^When he sees you his face lights up

b: ^ and his whole manner changes, visibly relaxing.

c-0: ^Do you want to get a table in the shade and have an icecream?
^You settle Otis at a bench in the shade outside the restaurant, while you go inside to get icecream.
^When you come out Otis seems a bit skittish, but he tucks into the icecream you offer him.
c-1: ^Do you want to go somewhere quieter?
^It gets a bit noisy with the pups around.
^The two of you go for a
^ over to a nice bench in the shade of the trees.

c-2: ^I love them! I would love to have a big family.
c-3: ^The older ones are fine. You know, once they stop all the messy stuff.
c-5: ^Nope, I'm not really interested in rug rats.
^Oh, that's a bit of a shame. I don't mind them once they get a bit older.
^It's the running and noisy stage that makes my ears twitch.

part_2: ^Otis fidgets back and forth in the shade as the two of you sit, settling himself down with a slightly nervous sidelong glance at you.

c-0: ^Hey, do you want to play fetch?
^Uhh, sure? We can do that for a bit, if you like.
c-1: ^C'mon, lets see if you can catch me!
^Otis looks worried as you dash off. He scampers after you as quickly as his  little legs can carry him.
c-2: ^Otis throws himself into a staggering walk that could win praise on the hammyest stage before rolling over in a perfect mockery of death, doggy tongue lolling and eyes rolling.
^It's such a funny site you can't help but laugh.
^Together the two of you spend a happy time together, Otis demonstrating a surprisingly wide repertoire of increasingly clever tricks.
c-3: ^The two of you sit together in companionable silence, the only noises the wind in the trees and the occasional shuffle of paws.

part_3: ^After a lovely afternoon in the park it's finally time to take Otis back to the shelter.

b: ^ It's tough to take the little fuzzball back, you kind of want the afternoon to last forever.

part_3: ^On the walk back you feel Otis stiffen on the lead, his attention fixed on a now empty stretch of pavement in a side road.

g-1: ^Otis shakes himself before starting to walk on.

c-1: ^Cats are great, they're cute little purr-balls.
c-2: ^Cats are good, I mean I like all sorts of animals.
c-3: ^I'm not really a fan. They're so aloof, it's hard to know what they're thinking.
^Yeah, me too. They seem to think their better than people, and I love people.
c-4: ^Cats are the worst. Did you know they can have a parasite in their pee that makes you actually like them? Bleh.

g-2: ^The two of you finish your walk back to the shelter, chatting aimiably. When you arrive
^ hand over his lead to the volunteer.
^ and turn away. But before you get two paces you draw up short.

c-5: ^Otis needs his forever home, and you know you can give him the love and stimulation that he really needs. You turn back and call out.
c-6: ^Otis is a great dog, but you're just not sure that the two of you are a perfect fit. With a heavy heart you return home.
^Maybe another dog will be the one for you.
